body_html: @purboo Not all tensors from a graph is needed. Some times you only need gradients to compute a backward, e.g., when multiplied with a scalar C, the gradient for input is just C times the gradient for output. :) So even if the tensor containing the output value is freed, you can still backprop for scalar multiplication. But this is not the case for f(x)=x^2.
